00021 namespace gmm {

00038 inline double phi(const double x, const double mean, const double var)
00039 {
00040   return exp(-1.0 * ((x - mean) * (x - mean) / (2 * var)))
00041       / sqrt(2 * M_PI * var);
00042 }
00043 
00060 inline double phi(const arma::vec& x,
00061                   const arma::vec& mean,
00062                   const arma::mat& cov)
00063 {
00064   arma::vec diff = mean - x;
00065 
00066   // Parentheses required for Armadillo 3.0.0 bug.
00067   arma::vec exponent = -0.5 * (trans(diff) * inv(cov) * diff);
00068 
00069   // TODO: What if det(cov) < 0?
00070   return pow(2 * M_PI, (double) x.n_elem / -2.0) * pow(det(cov), -0.5) *
00071       exp(exponent[0]);
00072 }
00073 
00086 inline double phi(const arma::vec& x,
00087                   const arma::vec& mean,
00088                   const arma::mat& cov,
00089                   const std::vector<arma::mat>& d_cov,
00090                   arma::vec& g_mean,
00091                   arma::vec& g_cov)
00092 {
00093   // We don't call out to another version of the function to avoid inverting the
00094   // covariance matrix more than once.
00095   arma::mat cinv = inv(cov);
00096 
00097   arma::vec diff = mean - x;
00098   // Parentheses required for Armadillo 3.0.0 bug.
00099   arma::vec exponent = -0.5 * (trans(diff) * inv(cov) * diff);
00100 
00101   long double f = pow(2 * M_PI, (double) x.n_elem / 2) * pow(det(cov), -0.5)
00102       * exp(exponent[0]);
00103 
00104   // Calculate the g_mean values; this is a (1 x dim) vector.
00105   arma::vec invDiff = cinv * diff;
00106   g_mean = f * invDiff;
00107 
00108   // Calculate the g_cov values; this is a (1 x (dim * (dim + 1) / 2)) vector.
00109   for (size_t i = 0; i < d_cov.size(); i++)
00110   {
00111     arma::mat inv_d = cinv * d_cov[i];
00112 
00113     g_cov[i] = f * dot(d_cov[i] * invDiff, invDiff) +
00114         accu(inv_d.diag()) / 2;
00115   }
00116 
00117   return f;
00118 }
00119 
00130 inline void phi(const arma::mat& x,
00131                 const arma::vec& mean,
00132                 const arma::mat& cov,
00133                 arma::vec& probabilities)
00134 {
00135   // Column i of 'diffs' is the difference between x.col(i) and the mean.
00136   arma::mat diffs = x - (mean * arma::ones<arma::rowvec>(x.n_cols));
00137 
00138   // Now, we only want to calculate the diagonal elements of (diffs' * cov^-1 *
00139   // diffs).  We just don't need any of the other elements.  We can calculate
00140   // the right hand part of the equation (instead of the left side) so that
00141   // later we are referencing columns, not rows -- that is faster.
00142   arma::mat rhs = -0.5 * inv(cov) * diffs;
00143   arma::vec exponents(diffs.n_cols); // We will now fill this.
00144   for (size_t i = 0; i < diffs.n_cols; i++)
00145     exponents(i) = exp(accu(diffs.unsafe_col(i) % rhs.unsafe_col(i)));
00146 
00147   probabilities = pow(2 * M_PI, (double) mean.n_elem / -2.0) *
00148       pow(det(cov), -0.5) * exponents;
00149 }
00150 
00151 }; // namespace gmm
00152 }; // namespace mlpack

00154 #endif
